results.title: The Forest of trees and logs
results.creator_credit: Jerome Kurtz, Michael Halperin, K Films and H/K Films
results.brief_description: The forest is explored as a place of life - an environment with inter-relationships harbouring the living, providing food, and which, even in decay brings forth vitality. Our understanding of the role forests play in the biosphere of the planet may help us aid the forests to return to the grandeur which once was theirs.

results.title: The Flying doctors [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Pino Amenta, Graham Moore, Charles Tingwell and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: New doctor Harry Callaghan (Andrew McFarlane) arrives for his first day of work with the Royal Flying Doctor Service (RFDS) at Coopers Crossing, resplendent in his white suit. At the same time, New Yorker Liz Drever (Lorna Patterson) makes travel arrangements with her mother to visit the “land down under.” Immediately flying to an emergency with local legend and resident Doctor Harry Sinclair (Keith Eden), the brash Dr. Callaghan finds himself struggling to break through a seemingly impenetrable veneer of locals to gain acceptance, particularly after what transpires on his first day. Presented here is the original four-hour mini series as the medics of Coopers Crossing contend with an array of medical complaints and social situations, not afraid to shy away from topical issues such as domestic abuse, racism and unionism, albeit conservatively. Originally screened in 1985, the series ran successfully on Australian television (and over 50 countries overseas) for five years at a total of 221 episodes - was briefly revived in 1992 as “RFDS” - but only lasted 3 episodes. The series proved profitable for the real RFDS of Australia who earned royalties from the series as well as international exposure. Features a glittering array of Australian actors as regulars and guest stars, including Bill Hunter, Maureen Edwards, Gil Tucker, Lenore Smith, Steve Bisley, Pat Evison, Max Cullen, Maurie Fields, Val Jellay and Bruce Barry to name just a few. Series written by Terry Stapleton.

results.title: The Fly = A Legy
results.brief_description: Creatively animated in sepia print, this Academy Award winning short provides a fly’s eye view of the world. Sensing the approach of autumn, the fly, hoping for safety, takes shelter in a house. Without commentary, sound effects only. Award: AMPAS 1980 Academy Award for Best Animated Short Subject. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Classical Hollywood style
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Pitkethly, Molly Ornati, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “American cinema”.
In classical Hollywood film, the story is primary. Filmmakers rely on style, structure, narrative and visual elements to tell their story. Martin Scorcese and Sydney Pollack are among the directors who discuss their own style and how the classical Hollywood style, although evolving, endures and impacts on their work.

results.title: Thinking and writing about film
results.creator_credit: Richard Smigielski, Brian Street, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “American cinema”.
Provides a formal and cultural analysis of a classical film sequence serving as a critical how-to guide for those new to film critique.

results.title: The Flower and the hive
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Larry Gosnell, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film showing the relationship between the activity of honey bees and the fertility of field and orchard crops. The process of cross-pollination of flowers by bees is observed in close-up. The life of the hive is similarly illustrated, including the curious dance by which a bee communicates the discovery of a new source of nectar to the colony in the hive .
results.creator_credit_for_label: J.V. Durden, Larry Gosnell, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Edge of Hollywood
results.creator_credit: Saskia Baron, Shana Swanson, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “American cinema”.
While many of the old rules are still in force, independent filmmakers often add their dissineting voices to the forum. This program looks at some alternative visions from new talents including Spike Lee, Joel and Ethan Coen, Jim Jarmusch and Quentin Tarantino. With limited budgets, they are challenging the stylistic status quo of the Hollywood film.

results.creator_credit: Greg Martinelli, Lorna Thomas, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “American cinema”.
This program offers interviews with contemporary directors, European film-makers, scholars, critics and studio-era veterans who probe Hollywood’s influence on both American and world culture.
